title: Annual Income and Age: Which Statement Is False?
question_text: x < 25,000 25,001 < x <50,000 50,001 < x < 100,000 100,000 < x Age under 30 37 31 14 1 Age 31-50 11 36 51 23 Age over 50 8 34 45 43 Researchers surveyed working adults and asked them their yearly income and age. Based on this table, which of the following statements is false?

choices.text: About 36 % 36 % of people surveyed are between 31 31 and 50 50 years old.
According to this chart, an experimenter has about a 10.8 % 10.8 % chance of randomly finding a 31 − 50 31 − 50 year old who earns between $ 25,001 $ 25,001 to $ 50,000 $ 50,000 per year.
A segmented bar graph would be an appropriate way to display this data.
It appears from this data that older people earn more money.
Based on the data, reaching age 50 50 guarantees a minimum income of $ 50,000 $ 50,000 .
